AcV.caption: value is changed
AcV.doc: Triggered when the picker date changes
AcV.name: date_selected

AcW.caption: invalid range selected
AcW.doc: Triggered when a range containing blocked dates is selected.
AcW.name: invalid_range

AcX.caption: picker is shown
AcX.doc: Triggered when the datepicker is shown
AcX.name: on_show

AcY.caption: picker is hidden
AcY.doc: Triggered when the datepicker is hiddden
AcY.name: on_hide

AcZ.caption: view changed
AcZ.doc: Triggered when datepicker's view is changed
AcZ.name: view_changed

Aca.caption: OK button is clicked (beta)
Aca.doc: Triggered when the pickers OK button is clicked
Aca.name: on_ok

Acb.caption: Show time (disabled for inline mode)
Acb.doc: Choose to show date only or both date and time
Acb.name: showtime

Acc.caption: Vertical position
Acc.doc: Vertical position of the date/time picker
Acc.name: verticalposition

Acd.caption: Horizontal position
Acd.doc: Horizontal position of the date/time picker
Acd.name: horizontalposition

Ace.caption: Initial date
Ace.doc: This field defines the input before the user modifies it or when reset. It can take dynamic values. For example "Current date/time" or "Current User's birthdate".
Ace.name: startdate

Acf.caption: Show Today button
Acf.doc: If checked, then button "Today" will be visible. Clicking on the button will select today's date.
Acf.name: todaybutton

Acg.caption: Auto close
Acg.doc: If true, then after date selection, datepicker will be closed.
Acg.name: autoclose

Ach.caption: Show Clear button
Ach.doc: If true, then button "Clear" will be visible.
Ach.name: clearbutton

Acj.caption: Language
Acj.doc: Select language for the date picker
Acj.name: language

Ack.caption: Only Timepicker (some date options below will not be applicable as expected)
Ack.name: onlytimepicker

Acl.caption: Automatically position date/time picker
Acl.doc: If selected the date/time picker will be automatically position if the specified position goes outside the screen area.
Acl.name: autoposition

Acm.caption: Minimum date
Acm.doc: Use this field to prevent users from choosing a day before a certain date. This field can be dynamic, in which case the expression defined should be of type date.
Acm.name: mindate

Acn.caption: Maximum date
Acn.doc: Use this field to prevent users from choosing a day after a certain date. This field can be dynamic, in which case the expression defined should be of type date
Acn.name: maxdate

Aco.caption: First day of week (if nothing is selected value is taken from current localization)
Aco.doc: By default value is taken from current localization, but if it passed here then it will have higher priority.
Aco.name: firstday

Acw.caption: Enable keyboard navigation
Acw.doc: If checked, then users can navigate through calendar by keyboard. Use Ctrl + arrow keys to move one month forward or backward. Shift + arrow keys to move one year forward or backward. Alt + arrow keys to move 10 years forward or backward. Ctrl + Shift + arrow up to move next view. Esc to hide datepicker.
Acw.name: enablekeyboardnav

Acx.caption: Multiple dates (unlimited)
Acx.doc: If checked, then users can select unlimited dates.
Acx.name: multipledates

Acy.caption: Multiple dates (max number) - overrides Multiple dates (unlimited)
Acy.doc: Allow multiple dates up to the specified number.
Acy.name: multipledatesmax

Acz.caption: Enable date range? - overrides Multiple dates properties above
Acz.doc: If checked, users can select date ranges
Acz.name: enable_range

AdA.caption: Multiple Dates Separator
AdA.doc: String to use to separate multiple dates when displayed as text
AdA.name: dateseparator

AdB.caption: Initial range start date
AdB.doc: Initial start date when date range is selected
AdB.name: rangestart

AdC.caption: Initial range end date
AdC.doc: Initial end date when date range is selected
AdC.name: rangeend

AdD.caption: Minimum minutes (0 to 59)
AdD.doc: Minimal minutes value, must be between 0 and 59. You will not be able to choose value lower than this.Default is 0
AdD.name: minminutes

AdE.caption: Maximum minute  (0 to 59)
AdE.doc: Maximum minutes value, must be between 0 and 59. You will not be able to choose value higher than this.Default is 59
AdE.name: maxminutes

AdK.caption: Start view
AdK.doc: The initial view to show when datepicker opens.
AdK.name: view

AdN.caption: Use custom date format
AdN.doc: Check this box if you want to specify your own format. You must specify your format in the Custom format field
AdN.name: use_custom

AdO.caption: Custom date format (e.g. D. M d, yyyy for Wed. Jun 22, 1983) See docs for formats
AdO.doc: Specify the date format here. Options are: d-date number; dd-date with leading zero; D-short day name; DD-full day name; m-month number; mm-month number with leading zero; M-short month name; MM-full month name; yy-two digit year number; yyyy-four digit year number
AdO.name: custom_format

AdR.caption: Highlight color
AdR.doc: Color to use for highlights like selected day, month, year and today button text
AdR.name: highlight

AdT.caption: Placeholder text
AdT.doc: Enter the text to display if the element is empty. If no text is entered the current date or a time of 12:00pm will be displayed depending on whether only a date or time or both is being shown. The format will be the same format as chosen except for custom formats.
AdT.name: placeholder

AdU.caption: Use auto binding
AdU.doc: Check this box and Enable auto binding to use autobinding feature
AdU.name: use_auto_binding

AdW.caption: Toggle selected
AdW.doc: Allows you to toggle selected date. Uncheck this for possibility to select same date two times for range selector
AdW.name: toggle_selected

AdZ.caption: Inline (always visible)
AdZ.doc: Check this if you want the calendar to be always visible. Note that some options, actions and events will not longer be applicable.
AdZ.name: inline

Ada.caption: Use custom language
Ada.doc: Check this box to define your own language. Specify the language definition using exactly the template below. Make sure you do exactly as the template else it will break the plugin.
Ada.name: use_custom_lang

Adb.caption: Language definition
Adb.doc: Language definition as a json string. The format should be exactly like as specified. If there is any error parsing, English language would be used.
Adb.name: lang_definition

Adc.caption: Ensure that your language definition is exactly as specified. Verify with a json checker for any syntax errors.
Adc.name: lang_info

Add.caption: If using inline note that "value changed" event triggers for single dates and range (after selecting start and end) but never triggers for multiple dates option.
Add.name: inline_info

Ade.caption: Minimum view
Ade.doc: Minimal datepicker's view, on that view selecting cells will not trigger rendering next view, instead it will activate it. Use this to restrict the calendar to only one or two views. For example if you want to use the picker as only a month picker, set the Start view to months, and Minimum view to months.
Ade.name: minview

Adf.caption: Show OK button (beta)
Adf.doc: If checked an OK button will be shown. Note that this feature is in beta so ensure you have tested its functionality very well before going live with it.
Adf.name: okbutton

Adg.caption: Inline update on click
Adg.doc: The property only applies to the inline. If checked the value of the picker will be update on click. If unchecked enable the OK button to update the picker value.
Adg.name: inline_updateonselect

Adk.caption: current view
Adk.doc: The current view of the picker.
Adk.name: view
